授業方法: This course will be conducted face to face in a regular classroom setting.

第1回: Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 2 hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.

Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.  Start preparing for a research proposal.  Feedback will be given in class.

Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.  Prepare for   the research proposal.  Feedback will be given in class.
第4回: Week IV   Japan and the Liberal International Order (1) / Research Proposal Consultations
Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.
第5回: Week V    Japan and the Liberal International Order (2) / Research Proposal Consultations
Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.

Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.
第7回: Week VII  Legacy of War in Japanese Diplomacy: Lessons from Europe?
Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.
第8回: Week VIII Legacy of War in Japanese Diplomacy: Yasukuni Shrine Issue
Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.
第9回: Week IX   Legacy of War in Japanese Diplomacy: Comfort Women/ Wartime Laborers Issue
Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.
第10回: Week X    Legacy of War in Japanese Diplomacy: Political Regime in Reconciliation
Assigned reading to be completed before coming to class.  Approximately 1-hour study.  Students' understanding will be checked in class.

Research and presentation preparation will be required.  Approximately 15 to 20-hour study between Sessions 5 and 13.  Feedback will be given after the presentation in class.
